senses.de: A test to learn or prove something
senses.ex: The scientists conducted an experiment to see the effect of the new drug on mice.

Tips.title: Curiosity Driven
Tips.description: Use 'experiment' when highlighting an action taken to satisfy curiosity or explore possibilities.
Tips.example: Our class experiment on plant growth sparked many questions.

Tips.title: Beyond Classrooms
Tips.description: 'Experiment' isn't limited to science; it can describe trying out new ideas in various fields.
Tips.example: The marketing team's new ad campaign is an exciting experiment in social media.

Tips.title: Learning Process
Tips.description: 'Experiment' emphasizes learning from the process, regardless of the outcome.
Tips.example: Their cooking experiment was a disaster, but they learned a lot.

senses.de: A situation done as a test to see what the result will be
senses.ex: Starting my own business was an experiment to see if I could succeed.

Tips.title: Life Application
Tips.description: 'Experiment' can refer to a personal test, like trying new activities or lifestyles.
Tips.example: She considered her year abroad as an experiment in independence.

Tips.title: Initiative Test
Tips.description: Starting something new with uncertain results can be called an 'experiment'.
Tips.example: Living off-grid for a month was a personal experiment for him.

senses.de: To try something in order to learn more or test an idea
senses.ex: He is experimenting with different materials in his sculptures.

Tips.title: Creative Exploration
Tips.description: Use 'experiment' to describe playful attempts in the arts or innovation.
Tips.example: The band is experimenting with new genres in their latest album.

Tips.title: Informal Testing
Tips.description: 'Experimenting' can mean casually testing things without strict procedures.
Tips.example: She's experimenting with various ingredients to perfect the recipe.

senses.de: A test done in a controlled way to study what happens
senses.ex: In the physics experiment, they observed the behavior of the light.

Tips.title: Controlled Conditions
Tips.description: 'Experiment' in science implies conditions are controlled to get accurate results.
Tips.example: They kept the temperature constant during the chemistry experiment.

Tips.title: Objective Observations
Tips.description: In a scientific 'experiment', observations should be objective, not biased.
Tips.example: The researcher documented each reaction meticulously during the experiment.

Tips.title: Reproducible Results
Tips.description: A key component of scientific 'experiments' is reproducibility of the results.
Tips.example: The physics experiment was repeated to confirm the initial findings.

Analysis.wordDefinition:
Analysis refers to the process of examining and evaluating something using a methodical and logical approach. It involves breaking down a complex idea or problem into smaller parts to better understand it.

Analysis can be applied in a variety of fields such as science, mathematics, literature, and business.

In simpler terms, analysis is when you analyze something that already exists, while an experiment is when you create something new and test it out to see how it works.

Analysis is used to understand things, while experiments are used to find answers to questions or to solve problems.

Examination.wordDefinition:
Examination refers to the process of observing, analyzing, and assessing something already existing to understand it better or to evaluate its condition.

It is usually a detailed investigation or inspection of something. An examination can be applied when you want to study and evaluate something that already exists.

The primary difference between examination and experiment is that the former focuses on analyzing existing things, while the latter is used to test a new idea or theory.

Investigate.wordDefinition:
Investigate means to investigate or to examine something to gain knowledge, to understand its nature, or to find out facts.

Investigation can be done in various fields such as science, law, journalism, or detective work. It involves gathering information, analyzing it, and drawing conclusions based on the findings.

Experiment is applicable in the scientific field, while investigation can be used in a broader sense. Experimentation is a more formal process, while investigation can be less structured and can happen in various contexts.

Pilot.wordDefinition:
A pilot is a trial or initial stage of a project or program.

A pilot is applicable in various fields, including business, education, and healthcare, and is used to assess the feasibility, effectiveness, and efficiency of a particular concept, product, or service.

Probe.wordDefinition:
A probe generally refers to a tool or instrument used to gather information or data.

In simpler terms, an experiment is a test conducted in a controlled environment to learn or prove something, while a probe is a tool or method used to collect information or investigate something.

Study.wordDefinition:
A study refers to a systematic investigation or examination of a topic.

Studies can be used to understand the prevalence of a condition, to identify risk factors, or to explore the experiences of individuals.

For example, a researcher may conduct a study to investigate how teenagers are affected by social media.

An experiment is used when researchers want to isolate and manipulate variables to test cause-and-effect relationships, while a study is used to examine and analyze data to draw conclusions about a topic.

Test.wordDefinition:
An experiment is a scientific procedure used to test a hypothesis or theory. It involves the manipulation of variables in a controlled environment to observe and measure the outcomes.

A test is a procedure used to evaluate or measure the performance, skill or knowledge of an individual, system, or product.

Tests can be conducted in a variety of settings and can be used for different purposes than experiments. For example, a driving test is used to evaluate a person's ability to operate a vehicle safely, while a software test is used to check if a program works correctly.

An experiment is used to test a hypothesis or theory, while a test is used to assess the performance or knowledge of something or someone.

Trial.wordDefinition:
A trial is a legal process in which a person or organization is accused of committing a crime or breaking a law. The aim of a trial is to prove whether or not the accused party is guilty, and to determine an appropriate punishment if they are found guilty.

For example, a person might stand trial for theft if they are suspected of stealing something.

In general, experiments are used in scientific contexts to test theories and gather new knowledge, while trials are used in legal contexts to determine guilt or innocence.

quotes.Text: I've been in the studio experimenting on making a CD of my own. I'm trying out different producers, styles, sounds. With music, as opposed to acting, you are not playing a character. You are showing people who you are. I really want to have my spirit in it.
quotes.Title: American Actress
quotes.Name: Emmy Rossum

quotes.Text: I have nothing new to teach the world. Truth and Non-violence are as old as the hills. All I have done is to try experiments in both on as vast a scale as I could.
quotes.Title: Indian Leader
quotes.Name: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.Text: A lot of times, I run a thought experiment: 'If I were not at Facebook, what would I be doing to make the world more open?
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Mark Zuckerberg

quotes.Text: Yes, natural is good and healthy, and whole foods are important. However, experimentation is important, too.
quotes.Title: American Chef
quotes.Name: David Chang

quotes.Text: All life is an experiment. The more experiments you make the better.
quotes.Title: American Philosopher
quotes.Name: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.Text: I like experimenting and picking up trends from across the world.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Gurmeet Choudhary

quotes.Text: A fool is a man who never tried an experiment in his life.
quotes.Title: English Scientist
quotes.Name: Erasmus Darwin

quotes.Text: Have I got the right to experiment with my child's life?
quotes.Title: Australian Cartoonist
quotes.Name: Michael Leunig

quotes.Text: If I experiment enough, I get a deeper understanding.
quotes.Title: Australian Mathematician
quotes.Name: Terence Tao

quotes.Text: Life is too short not to experiment.
quotes.Title: English Musician
quotes.Name: Jamelia
